children.value: If you've been keeping up with the sweetest new static-site generation tools, you'll have heard of the JAMstack.
And if you havent, don't worry it's a niche web developer thing -

The TLDR here is that combining Javascript, APIs, and Markup (JAM) makes it easy to build sites that work well across all kinds of devices and data loading speeds. Which, like jam, makes everyone happy.
Two popular tools for building JAMstack sites are
. Gatsby is a framework for building the actual site, and Contentful is a Content Management System (CMS) - aka. where you stick all the images, text, and data.
that walks you through hooking these two up
Here's some notes I took while working through it...

<FullWidthImage width="860px"  alt="Build progressive web apps with contentful and gatsby" src="https://res.cloudinary.com/dg3gyk0gu/image/upload/c_scale,w_680/v1592262609/maggieappleton.com/egghead-course-notes/gatsby-contentful/gatsbycontentful1.png" />

<FullWidthImage width="860px"  alt="The JAM stack is a new way to build web apps for speed and scalability. It uses Javascript, APIs, and Markup." src="https://res.cloudinary.com/dg3gyk0gu/image/upload/c_scale,w_900/v1592262609/maggieappleton.com/egghead-course-notes/gatsby-contentful/gatsbycontentful2.png" />

<FullWidthImage width="860px"  alt="These two work well together - contentful feeds the data into gatsby. You structure all your content inside contentful, which then goes into gatsby through the gatsby-source-contentful plugin." src="https://res.cloudinary.com/dg3gyk0gu/image/upload/c_scale,w_900/v1592262609/maggieappleton.com/egghead-course-notes/gatsby-contentful/gatsbycontentful3.png" />

<FullWidthImage width="860px"  alt="We can create new pages for our site inside gatsby-node.js. The gatsby node API gives us a creatPage action" src="https://res.cloudinary.com/dg3gyk0gu/image/upload/c_scale,w_900/v1592262611/maggieappleton.com/egghead-course-notes/gatsby-contentful/gatsbycontentful4.png" />

<FullWidthImage width="860px"  alt="The full gatsby and contentful illustrated note" src="https://res.cloudinary.com/dg3gyk0gu/image/upload/c_scale,w_900/v1592262613/maggieappleton.com/egghead-course-notes/gatsby-contentful/gatsbycontentful_sketchnotes--mini.png" />
